titleStmt.title: Description of Sefer Ginat egoz, with additional comments and notes of Johannes Reuchlin.

notesStmt.note: Water-damaged (especially the upper margin). Slightly worm-eaten towards the gutter.

Johannes Reuchlin: inscribed in an entry, showing that the manuscript was presented to him in 1495 by Johannes Dalburg, bishop of Worms: folio 206r. Otto Gereon von Gutmann of Sobernheim, archbishop of Cyrene: inscribed, 1624: folios 205r-205v; his coat of arms, folio 205v. A seal is affixed to the left-hand lower corner on folio 205r, and also on the lower margin of folio 13r.An entry on the earliest foliation of the manuscript, folio 12v.
Manuscript description based on Margoliouth, G.: Catalogue of the Hebrew and Samaritan Manuscripts in the British Museum, London 1965.

msContents.summary: Sefer Ginat egoz, with additional comments and notes of Johannes Reuchlin.

supportDesc.foliation: Foliated several times: in 1576 the leaves now numbered 13-205 were marked 1-192 (number 137 is repeated); in the middle of the lower margin is a later foliation in red ink; much later is the enumeration 1-206 counted backwards, on account of the Latin portions at the beginning and at the end.

collation.p: Quires of mostly 16 leaves each, marked by catchwords at the end (only partly preserved).

scriptDesc.scriptNote: Ashkenazi semi-cursive and Latin cursive scripts of the 16th century.

binding.p: BM/BL in-house. Boxed. Spine: 'Joseph Gikatilla. Ginnath Eghoz. Hebrew. Brit. Mus. Additional Ms. 11416.'

history.provenance: Acquisition: Purchased by the British Museum at Evans' sale, lot 1134, on 26 July 1838: inscribed, folio [210v].
